comments.body: I don't really like the idea of returning from the function early if `options.keepOpen` is `true`. That could require more refactoring if we ever decided to add more functionality here. It also makes the code less readable IMO. Also, 100% of legacy code and probably the majority of new code would have `keepOpen = false`, meaning that it would have to run two separate `if` statements instead of only checking `keepOpen` if `handle` is truthy.
Just noting that this allows a `send(message, callback, options)` signature.
I thought I saw that `const` could trigger deopts in functions, cc/ @mscdex

It *can* but it's not always immediately obvious if it actually will or not without checking during runtime (e.g. by adding `--trace-opt` and grepping for 'aborted' and/or 'disabled' in the resulting output).
